qas.question: Avoiding the strength of Ottoman trade was accomplished with the discovery of what?
What did the Portuguese discover in 1488?
Where did the Ottoman and Portuguese have Naval wars in the 16th century?
Who did the Ottomans ally with in the Indian Ocean?
New coins were a proclamation of independence by the Somali Muslim Ajuran Empire from whom?

context: The discovery of <a0_0>new maritime trade routes<a0_0/> by Western European states allowed them to avoid the Ottoman trade monopoly. The Portuguese discovery of <a1_0>the Cape of Good Hope<a1_0/> in 1488 initiated a series of Ottoman-Portuguese naval wars in <a2_0>the Indian Ocean<a2_0/> throughout the 16th century. <a3_0>The Somali Muslim Ajuran Empire<a3_0/>, allied with the Ottomans, defied the Portuguese economic monopoly in the Indian Ocean by employing a new coinage which followed the Ottoman pattern, thus proclaiming an attitude of economic independence in regard to <a4_0>the Portuguese<a4_0/>.
